thread.title: Salmon company Tassal ordered to empty fish pens in Macquarie Harbour lease
thread.title_full: Salmon company Tassal ordered to empty fish pens in Macquarie Harbour lease

title: Salmon company Tassal ordered to empty fish pens in Macquarie Harbour lease
text: A scientific study into salmon farming on the edge of Tasmania's World Heritage area near Strahan, has found one lease has had such an environmental impact that the fish pens need to be emptied. The Macquarie Harbour lease is run by Australia's largest salmon producer TassalAnd the head of Tasmania's Environment Protection Authority says the company has been given until the end of this month to empty the pens. Featured: Wes Ford, director of the Environment Protection AuthorityLaura Kelly, director of Environment Tasmania
